question: 紛らす
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>distract</kanji> and the verb vocab version of this word is <vocabulary>to distract</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to divert</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You need <vocabulary>to divert</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>to distract</vocabulary> <reading>Maggie</reading> (<ja>まぎ</ja>).
